Personal Goals

5 goals I'd like to work towards over the next 6 months.

UX Architecture

Current: Support 6 month goal: Collaborator

Over my career I've worked closely with designers to help better understand their process and contribute helpful insight into their UX problems. I want to continue this at Aviture and help facilitate a closer relationship between designer and developer.

Frontend Javascript

Current: Support. 6 month goal: Collaborator.

Before joining Aviture my javascript experience was with libraries like jQuery. I had an understanding of some core programing concepts but I'd like to become more fluent. Use this to improve my problem solving skills and apply those to working with frontend javascript.

Frontend CSS architecture

Current: Collaborator. 6 month goal: Leader

Coming into Aviture a year ago I had really strong understanding of CSS. Since then I haven't done much with CSS because Decision Logic had a lot of those CSS/UX patterns in place. I like to start working more with CSS and building design guides along with new css techniques like grids and variables. From there I'd love to be one of the leaders within Aviture for resources on building out new design systems and collaborating with the UX team.

Prototyping

Current: Support. 6 month goal: Collaborator

I've seen big benefits of prototyping on Decision Logic but for me I still seem to pull up an editing application like Sketch to work through prototypes. I'd love to be able to jump into a project and wire out a working prototype for a new feature or stand up a new project to test out new libraries.

Accessibility

Current: Beginner. 6 month goal: Support

This is something I've had some experience with in the past. A client's site was part of a class action suite for not passing some basic accessibility. I'd like to start building a foundation on how build projects with accessibility in mind especially with government projects that I could see greatly benefit from it.

Novice
Can work with the tools at a basic level to contribute some work product. Must typically work with others in order to contribute non-trivial output.

Support
Knows how to take granular level tasks, and contribute work output. Typically over-watched by more senior members of the team, who use tools and processes to ensure work quality.

Collaborator
Can contribute work product with team and individual trust that the work product is at Aviture’s quality level. Can typically take less granular work and break it down into granular tasks. Can review “support” or “beginner” level work. Could work independently as the sole resonpsibility on small or medium sized Aviture projects.

Leader
Can take very high level features or needs, and break down said needs into distinct tasks. Is capable of completing the most difficult work product tasks within a project. Can handle review and quality responsibilities. Demonstrates ability to lead Aviture's more complex are reource intensive efforts.

Expert
Leads process, tooling, and systematic decisions for how the work gets accomplished across Aviture . Leads the strategic thinking and direction on Aviture's most difficult project.
